lines.text: My acting is the talk of Savannah.
My acting is the scandal of Hollywood!
I'm General Marmaduke Oldfish Pepper, of Georgia.
You ain't gonna blame me for that, are you?

[looks at Peggy's makeup]
Remember, Baby, you're not painting a bungalow.
Pardon my depravity, but that terrible comedian person is downstairs.
To hopeful hundreds there is a golden spot on the map called - HOLLYWOOD.
Where's the dame you were going to bring out?
That's darn good hokum.
I came here to do drama. Why didn't you tell me it was this?
But, Baby, all the stars have had to take it on the chin - Swanson, Daniels, Lloyd - all of them. Come on, Baby - you've gone this far - it'll be easy from now on.
What's the matter, Baby? Don't you know you're a wow?
What do you want to see a punk drama for? Come on.
That's the kind of acting I'm gonna do some day. That's real art!
Don't be sil. Make 'em laugh and you make 'em happy.

[Talking to Peggy]
Will you please sign my album? I'm crazy about signatures.
[Leaves after getting Peggy's autograph]
Who is that little guy?
Charlie Chaplin.
[Shocked, Peggy faints]
It's all in the game, Baby. I guess it's the crossroads - your path leads one way and mine another.
She has the temperament of Nazimova, the appeal of Garbo, the sweetness of Pickford, and the lure of Pola Negri!
I'm terribly, terribly sorry if I kept you waiting.
Waiting is such sweet sorrow where you are concerned, dear lady.
Why, Peggy - surely success hasn't gone to the old bean!
Gee, Baby, I'll bet you miss the laughs we used to have!
I never miss lowness, cheapness and vulgarity.

[Sees a woman getting out of a car, with a tennis racket, at the MGM lot]
Who is that?
That's Marion Davis.
Marion Davis!
[Frowns, shakes her head disapprovingly]
